title: HOW TO START A WORM FARM | DIY Worm Farm | Worm Farm Setup | Hey It's a Good Life

tasks.task: How to build a worm farm
subtasks: Find wooden pallets or scrap wood (be sure they are heat-treated)
Drill holes for airflow and drainage in the bins
Staple quarter-inch mesh around the frames for support
Construct a frame using screws and drill bits to ensure stability

tasks.task: Prepare the bedding for the worms
subtasks: Lay down cardboard or newspaper along the drainage holes
Add brown layers (e.g., shredded newspaper, cardboard)
Water the browns with chlorine-free water
Add food scraps and grit, then water lightly
Add compost, soil, or peat moss as bedding
Add more brown layers on top

tasks.task: Maintain and harvest the worm farm
subtasks: Wait 2-3 months for castings to form
Use worm tea for foliar feeding or root drenching
Replicate layers and add worms/castings to soil if desired
